title: mirror
description: Write a function `mirror` that takes a binary search tree and returns a new tree that is the mirror image of the original (left and right subtrees swapped).

examples.explanation: The mirror of an empty tree is empty
The mirror of a single node is the same node
Left and right children are swapped

starterCode:
(define-struct node (left right key))

(define (mirror t))

(mirror empty)
(mirror (make-node empty empty 5))
(mirror (make-node (make-node empty empty 2) (make-node empty empty 8) 5))
hiddenCases: (check-expect (mirror (make-node (make-node empty empty 2) (make-node empty empty 8) 5)) (make-node (make-node empty empty 8) (make-node empty empty 2) 5))

(check-expect (mirror (make-node (make-node (make-node empty empty 1) (make-node empty empty 3) 2) (make-node (make-node empty empty 6) (make-node empty empty 8) 7) 5)) (make-node (make-node (make-node empty empty 8) (make-node empty empty 6) 7) (make-node (make-node empty empty 3) (make-node empty empty 1) 2) 5))
(check-expect (mirror (make-node empty (make-node empty (make-node empty empty 10) 8) 5)) (make-node (make-node (make-node empty empty 10) empty 8) empty 5))
(check-expect (mirror (make-node (make-node empty empty 2) empty 5)) (make-node empty (make-node empty empty 2) 5))

(check-expect (mirror (make-node (make-node (make-node (make-node empty empty 1) empty 3) empty 7) (make-node empty (make-node empty empty 15) 12) 10)) (make-node (make-node (make-node empty empty 15) empty 12) (make-node empty (make-node empty (make-node empty empty 1) 3) 7) 10))
(check-expect (mirror (make-node (make-node (make-node (make-node empty empty 1) empty 3) empty 7) empty 10)) (make-node empty (make-node empty (make-node empty (make-node empty empty 1) 3) 7) 10))

(check-expect (mirror (make-node empty (make-node (make-node (make-node empty empty 13) empty 17) (make-node empty empty 25) 20) 15)) (make-node (make-node (make-node empty empty 25) (make-node empty (make-node empty empty 13) 17) 20) empty 15))

(check-expect (mirror (make-node (make-node (make-node (make-node (make-node empty empty 1) empty 4) empty 6) empty 9) (make-node (make-node empty empty 14) (make-node empty empty 18) 16) 12)) (make-node (make-node (make-node empty empty 18) (make-node empty empty 14) 16) (make-node empty (make-node empty (make-node empty (make-node empty empty 1) 4) 6) 9) 12))
